conclusion: To determine the relationship between the accelerations of Car A and Car B based on the given velocity-time (vt) graph, analyze the slopes of the curves.
The slope of a velocity-time graph represents acceleration.
The slope of the curve for Car A is decreasing over time.
The slope of the curve for Car B is increasing over time.
For Car A, the decreasing slope indicates that the acceleration is decreasing.
For Car B, the increasing slope indicates that the acceleration is increasing.
At t = 0, the slope of Car A's curve is steeper than that of Car B.
At t = 0, Car A has a higher initial acceleration than Car B.
As time progresses towards t = t1, the slope of Car A's curve decreases, while the slope of Car B's curve increases.
Initially, Car A has a higher acceleration than Car B.
Over time, Car A's acceleration decreases, and Car B's acceleration increases.
At some point between t = 0 and t = t1, the accelerations of Car A and Car B will be equal.
After this point, Car B's acceleration will be greater than Car A's acceleration.
By t = t1, Car B has a higher acceleration than Car A.
During the period from t = 0 to t = t1, the magnitude of the acceleration of Car A gradually decreases, while the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B gradually increases.
